article:
Alhaji 'Yahaya Abubakar' (born 12 September 1952) to the family of Alhaji
Abubakar Saganuwa his father and his mother Hajiya Habiba Bantigi Ndayako and
was appointed the 13th Etsu Nupe [Bida Emirate], or traditional ruler of the
Nupe Kingdom on 11 September 2003. {{Cite web
|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/200903050153.html |title=As New Makaman Nupe
Steps in |work=ThisDay |author=Agha Ibiam |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2010-09-
04}}

Yahaya was born on September 12, 1952 at Bida in what is today Niger State, and
comes from the ruling house of Etsu Musa compound. He attended Government
College, Sokoto and Commercial College, Kano (1967â1971), then enrolled in the
Nigerian Defence Academy, Kaduna (1973â1975) in preparation for joining the
army. Kusodu's last military posting was to the Defence Headquarters in Abuja,
where he was a director of foreign operations, before retiring as a brigadier
general in September 2003. {{Cite web
|url=http://news.biafranigeriaworld.com/archive/2003/sep/12/0008.html
|date=September 12, 2003 |title=Yahaya Abubakar Kusodu becomes 13th Etsu Nupe
|author=Kasim Sule |work=Daily Trust |accessdate=2010-09-04}} Kusodu was
appointed the 13th Etsu Nupe on 11 September 2003, traditional leader of the
Nupe people who live in Niger, Kogi, Kwara and Benue states, in succession to
Alhaji Umar Sanda Ndayako. By virtue of this title he is chairman of the Niger
State Council of Traditional Rulers.

Kusodu was chair of a committee pushing for the creation of Edu State, with
headquarters at Bida, out of the present Niger and Kwara states, to form a
homeland for the Nupe people. {{Cite web |url=http://ndn.nigeriadailynews.c-
om/templates/default.aspx?a=18878&template=print-article.htm |title=Etsu Nupe,
Gana Present Proposal On Edu State |date=July 16, 2009 |author=Philip Nyam
|work=Nigeria Daily News |accessdate=2010-09-04}} Other promoters of the
new state are the Etsu Lapai, Umar Baogo III, and the Etsu Agaie, Muhammadu Kudu
Abubakar. {{Cite web |url=http://www.compassnewspaper.com/~compas/NG/index.-
php?option=com_content&view=article&id=22684:bankole-endorses-call-for-creation-
of-edu-state-from-niger-kwara&Itemid=7966 |title=Bankole endorses call for
creation of Edu State from Niger, Kwara |date=16 JULY 2009 |author=HOPE AFOKE
ORIVRI |work=Nigerian Compass |accessdate=2010-09-11}} Following a scandal
when it was found that a Nupe man, Alhaji Muhammadu Bello Masaba, had married 86
wives, the Etsu Nupe set up a five-member committee of Islamic scholars to
handle the issue. In September 2008 it was reported that Masaba has agreed to
divorce all but four of the wives. {{Cite web
|url=http://www.wluml.org/node/4779 |title=Polygamist agrees to divorce 82 of
his 86 wives, following death threats |work=Daily Trust |date=1 September 2008
|accessdate=2010-09-04}}
